concise_definition: v. 决定, 确定, 限定, 决断

definitions.explanation_en: To make a decision or come to a conclusion about something after consideration, often based on evidence, reasoning, or external factors.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指经过思考、证据或外部因素后，对某事做出决定或得出结论。
definitions.example_en: The judge will determine the sentence based on the evidence presented.
definitions.example_cn: 法官将根据所呈交的证据来判定刑罚。

definitions.explanation_en: To establish or fix the limits, scope, or nature of something definitively.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指明确地界定、设定某事物的范围、界限或性质。
definitions.example_en: The contract determines the responsibilities of each party.
definitions.example_cn: 合同明确了各方的责任。

definitions.explanation_en: To cause something to happen or to be the deciding factor in an outcome.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指成为决定某事结果的关键因素或促成某事发生。
definitions.example_en: Her determination determined the success of the entire project.
definitions.example_cn: 她的决心决定了整个项目的成败。

comparison.analysis: “Decide” (决定) 更侧重于在多个选项中做出选择，强调主观意愿和最终抉择，常用于日常语境。而 “determine” 更强调通过分析、证据或外部条件得出一个必然或客观的结论，语气更正式、更权威。
“Establish” (确立) 指通过正式程序或长期努力使某事物被认可或固定下来，如建立制度、规则。它强调的是“使存在”或“使稳固”，而 “determine” 更强调“界定”或“决定结果”，不一定需要长期过程。
“Ascertain” (查明) 侧重于通过调查、研究或验证来确认一个事实或真相，常用于获取未知信息。而 “determine” 不仅包含查明，还包含基于查明的信息做出判断或设定界限，语义范围更广。
